intro: Helosciadium laciniatum var. humile, commonly known as the dwarf cutleaf bellflower, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, hairy stems that produce clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or purple. The leaves are deeply lobed and have a distinctive, finely cut appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This plant is often cultivated for its delicate flowers and is relatively easy to grow in garden settings.
